thread.title: Premier League unleash stylish new design of names and numbers for next season's kits
thread.title_full: Premier League unleash stylish new design of names and numbers for next season's kits

author: Alex Smith
title: Premier League unleash stylish new design of names and numbers for next season's kits
text:
Sport Premier League unleash stylish new design of names and numbers for next season's kits Hull, Southampton, Watford, Tottenham, Stoke and Chelsea have also seen how their stars will look from behind in the 2017/18 campaign Share This is what Dele Alli and Troy Deeney's back will look like next season (Photo: Premier League) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The Premier League have given fans a snapshot into next season by releasing new names and numbers. 
Clubs have been given time to adapt their kit designs for next to include the slightly different fonts. 
The biggest change from this season is the inclusion of the new Premier League badge - which was brought in at the start of this season. 
The logo was not on this year's design due to a blunder from bosses - instead showing the old version. Marouane Fellaini and Jessie Lingard show off the back of this season's shirts (Photo: John Peters) Read More Premier League leaked kits: What will your club be wearing in 2017/18? 
Hull fans have been shown a glimpse at what could be an alternative reality - with the version which could be on their shirts next season included in the promotional gif. 
The Tigers are three points adrift in the bottom three and haven't been out the relegation zone since October. 
Southampton, Watford, Tottenham, Stoke and Chelsea have also seen how their stars will look from behind in the 2017/18 campaign. Ilkay Gundogan and Gabriel Jesus display the league's first sleeve logo (Photo: REUTERS) The new look Premier League badge which was brought in this season (Photo: PA) Read More Gabriel Jesus takes break from recovery as Manchester City become first club to reveal sleeve sponsors 
Apparently clubs did not receive the logo earlier enough before the season to make it onto the numbers - although it is sported on the sleeves. 
Top-flight side could also rake in up to Â£10million more per season from next term from selling advertising space on their shirt sleeves for the first time. 
Manchester City were the first to show off their new style sleeves last week when they unveiled Nexen Tires as their sponsor. poll loading Do you like the new Premier League name and number design? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
